update.description:
Builds on top of pull request #2838

While tackling issue #2390 (upgrade to `ignition::math::Color`), I couldn't help myself from tackling a lot of other issues I saw on `rendering::MovableText`:

* Remove boost
* PIMPL
* Document
* Implement functions which were only declared
* Deprecate `Get` functions
* Use `override`
* Add tests for setters and getters (the tests don't check the rendering results though)
* Add an example plugin
* :new: Removed unused private functions `getWorldOrientation` and `getWorldPosition`
* :new: Deprecated `_setupGeometry` and `_updateColors` to conform to style

![movabletext.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/401554032-movabletext.gif)

~~Some things I didn't tackle:~~

~~* `getWorldOrientation` and `getWorldPosition` are private functions which are never used, I think we could delete them or at least change them to conform to our style~~
~~* The documentation on `_setupGeometry` and `_updateColors` implies they are overriding Ogre functions, but I don't think they are. We could then deprecate them and change their names so they conform to our style.~~
update.title: Updates to MovableText

content.raw: Done and tested locally: 6a3da92
content.html: Done and tested locally: 6a3da92

content.raw:
![textfrustom.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/679355395-textfrustom.gif)

This shows 2 things:

* When zooming too close and the text is closer than the near plane, it disappears
* When the text is not fully contained in the frustum (when it goes out on the side) it disappears

But I can't confirm my previous suspicion about camera angles.
content.html:
This shows 2 things:

  • When zooming too close and the text is closer than the near plane, it disappears
  • When the text is not fully contained in the frustum (when it goes out on the side) it disappears

But I can't confirm my previous suspicion about camera angles.

content.raw: I'll try building the example against gazebo8 and see if it's there too
content.html: I'll try building the example against gazebo8 and see if it's there too

content.html: Can you refer to specific timecodes in the video? I don't exactly know the camera frustum shape, so it's hard for me to say

content.raw: From your video, it looks like it also may be outside of the camera frustum when it disappears?
content.html: From your video, it looks like it also may be outside of the camera frustum when it disappears?

content.raw: that probably has come from an old version of the MovableText code snippet. The [recent version](http://wiki.ogre3d.org/MovableText) uses `getWorldTransforms`. We probably don't want to change anything if our current version is working ok for us.
content.html: that probably has come from an old version of the MovableText code snippet. The recent version uses getWorldTransforms. We probably don't want to change anything if our current version is working ok for us.

diff -r e1063f2ec58f test/examples/examples_build.cc
--- a/test/examples/examples_build.cc	Thu Jan 04 14:20:35 2018 -0800
+++ b/test/examples/examples_build.cc	Thu Jan 04 14:46:01 2018 -0800
@@ -101,6 +101,7 @@
   , "mainwindow_example"
   , "model_push"
   , "model_move"
+  , "movable_text_demo"
   , "parameters"
   , "projector"
   , "system_gui_plugin"
~~~

update.description:
Builds on top of pull request #2838

While tackling issue #2390 (upgrade to `ignition::math::Color`), I couldn't help myself from tackling a lot of other issues I saw on `rendering::MovableText`:

* Remove boost
* PIMPL
* Document
* Implement functions which were only declared
* Deprecate `Get` functions
* Use `override`
* Add tests for setters and getters (the tests don't check the rendering results though)
* Add an example plugin

![movabletext.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/401554032-movabletext.gif)

Some things I didn't tackle:

* `getWorldOrientation` and `getWorldPosition` are private functions which are never used, I think we could delete them or at least change them to conform to our style
* The documentation on `_setupGeometry` and `_updateColors` implies they are overriding Ogre functions, but I don't think they are. We could then deprecate them and change their names so they conform to our style.
update.title: Updates to MovableText

content.raw: +1, I'll do that
content.html: +1, I'll do that

content.raw: I don't see `_setupGeometry` or `_updateColors` in the header files either, but they are `protected`, not `private`, so maybe they should be deprecated instead of directly renamed?
content.html: I don't see _setupGeometry or _updateColors in the header files either, but they are protected, not private, so maybe they should be deprecated instead of directly renamed?

content.raw:
Thanks for the feedback, I'll remove them.

What do you think of `_setupGeometry` and `_updateColors`? I think they're either ours or came from somewhere else (rviz?) when the code was ported to Gazebo. I feel like changing their style.
content.html:
Thanks for the feedback, I'll remove them.

What do you think of _setupGeometry and _updateColors? I think they're either ours or came from somewhere else (rviz?) when the code was ported to Gazebo. I feel like changing their style.

content.raw: I don't see `getWorldOrientation` or `getWorldPosition` in any of the ogre headers, so yeah we could probably delete them
content.html: I don't see getWorldOrientation or getWorldPosition in any of the ogre headers, so yeah we could probably delete them
